dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Andy Jassy taking over as Amazon CEO is just about maintaining the status quo, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Andy Jassy taking over as Amazon C E O is just about maintaining the status quo, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, not at all—he's stepping in right as they're facing an antitrust lawsuit from the District of Columbia, which is a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, not at all-he's stepping in right as they're facing an antitrust lawsuit from the District of Columbia, which is a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos also answered concerns about the companys impact on competition and regulatory scrutiny, a day after the District of Columbia filed an antitrust lawsuit against Amazon, believed to be the first against the company by a U.S. government agency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's also inheriting that massive $8.45 billion MGM acquisition. That's a lot of content to integrate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's also inheriting that massive eight point four five dollars billion M G M acquisition. That's a lot of content to integrate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But he will also have to manage intensifying regulatory scrutiny and growing calls from shareholders to improve the companys diversity practices and impact on civil rights, while helping to integrate and develop entertainment content after Wednesdays of Amazons $8.45 billion acquisition of film studio MGM.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Bezos really emphasized that Jassy won't let Amazon become "typical," which, uh, sounds like a dig at complacency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bezos really emphasized that Jassy won't let Amazon become typical, which, uh, sounds like a dig at complacency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Andy is well known inside the company, and has been at Amazon almost as long as I have, Bezos said during his final annual meeting as CEO Wednesday. Andy will never let the universe make us typical.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not all smooth sailing—shareholders are pushing hard for better diversity practices and civil rights audits.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not all smooth sailing-shareholders are pushing hard for better diversity practices and civil rights audits.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But he will also have to manage intensifying regulatory scrutiny and growing calls from shareholders to improve the companys diversity practices and impact on civil rights, while helping to integrate and develop entertainment content after Wednesdays of Amazons $8.45 billion acquisition of film studio MGM.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and there were proposals for third-party audits, similar to what Facebook and Airbnb have done.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and there were proposals for third-party audits, similar to what Facebook and Airbnb have done.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another proposal that received significant attention but failed to get majority support had called for the company to conduct a third-party audit of its impact on civil rights, similar to studies conducted by Facebook and Airbnb.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And employee concerns are mounting too, with unionization efforts and discrimination claims.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And employee concerns are mounting too, with unionization efforts and discrimination claims.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazons executives also sought to address the demands of its employees, who in the past year attempted to form a union, filed lawsuits discrimination and retaliation and called on leadership to bolster diversity hiring.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Alicia Boler Davis did address that, though—she said Amazon is committed to being the "safest employer."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alicia Boler Davis did address that, though-she said Amazon is committed to being the safest employer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alicia Boler Davis, Amazons vice president for global customer fulfillment, who the first Black woman to join Amazons small executive branch known as the S-Team last year, said the company is vowing to become both Earths best and safest employer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But hiring half a million people in one year? That's wild growth, but it brings its own challenges.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But hiring half a million people in one year? That's wild growth, but it brings its own challenges.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier in the meeting, chief financial officer Brian T. Olsavsky said Amazon hired 500,000 new employees in 2020, bringing its total to more than 1.3 million globally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely, and with 1.3 million employees globally, scaling culture and safety is no small feat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely, and with one point three million employees globally, scaling culture and safety is no small feat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier in the meeting, chief financial officer Brian T. Olsavsky said Amazon hired 500,000 new employees in 2020, bringing its total to more than 1.3 million globally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Financially, though, they're booming—$386 billion in sales, up 38% from last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Financially, though, they're booming-three hundred eighty six dollars billion in sales, up thirty eight percent from last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that Amazon generated $386 billion in sales, up 38% year-over-year, a figure bolstered by its market-leading cloud computing division, which generated $45 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: A huge chunk of that comes from AWS, which Jassy built into a $45 billion revenue machine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A huge chunk of that comes from A W S, which Jassy built into a forty five dollars billion revenue machine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that Amazon generated $386 billion in sales, up 38% year-over-year, a figure bolstered by its market-leading cloud computing division, which generated $45 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But now he's got to balance innovation with regulatory pressure—Bezos admitted scrutiny comes with success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But now he's got to balance innovation with regulatory pressure-Bezos admitted scrutiny comes with success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We recognize that with success comes scrutiny and we welcome it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he welcomed it, saying their goals align with competition: low prices, wide selection, convenience.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he welcomed it, saying their goals align with competition: low prices, wide selection, convenience.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We recognize that with success comes scrutiny and we welcome it. Our goals are in line with our competition, low prices, wide selection, convenience, and ever-improving innovation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, navigating government lawsuits and activist employees… that's a different ballgame for Jassy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, navigating government lawsuits and activist employees... that's a different ballgame for Jassy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Bezos seems confident, though—he said it'll be satisfying, even fun, for him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bezos seems confident, though-he said it'll be satisfying, even fun, for him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While it wont be easy, I do predict Andy will also find it satisfying, and oftentimes fun, Bezos said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Fun? Managing all that? I guess we'll see if his optimism holds up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fun? Managing all that? I guess we'll see if his optimism holds up.

artist_script:
HostA: Andy Jassy taking over as Amazon CEO is just about maintaining the status quo, isn't it?
HostB: Oh, not at all—he's stepping in right as they're facing an antitrust lawsuit from the District of Columbia, which is a huge deal.
HostA: Yeah, and he's also inheriting that massive $8.45 billion MGM acquisition. That’s a lot of content to integrate.
HostB: Bezos really emphasized that Jassy won't let Amazon become "typical," which, uh, sounds like a dig at complacency.
HostA: But it's not all smooth sailing—shareholders are pushing hard for better diversity practices and civil rights audits.
HostB: Right, and there were proposals for third-party audits, similar to what Facebook and Airbnb have done.
HostA: And employee concerns are mounting too, with unionization efforts and discrimination claims.
HostB: Alicia Boler Davis did address that, though—she said Amazon is committed to being the "safest employer."
HostA: But hiring half a million people in one year? That’s wild growth, but it brings its own challenges.
HostB: Absolutely, and with 1.3 million employees globally, scaling culture and safety is no small feat.
HostA: Financially, though, they’re booming—$386 billion in sales, up 38% from last year.
HostB: A huge chunk of that comes from AWS, which Jassy built into a $45 billion revenue machine.
HostA: But now he’s got to balance innovation with regulatory pressure—Bezos admitted scrutiny comes with success.
HostB: And he welcomed it, saying their goals align with competition: low prices, wide selection, convenience.
HostA: Still, navigating government lawsuits and activist employees… that’s a different ballgame for Jassy.
HostB: Bezos seems confident, though—he said it’ll be satisfying, even fun, for him.
HostA: Fun? Managing all that? I guess we’ll see if his optimism holds up.
